Edited November 7, 2014 by protonv

This is the only Skybox I have downloaded that looks just as good as the preview pic.

Running at UHD, 3840x2160 on my 50" Samsung TV.

All other skyboxes I have tried, show obvious pixleation, yet they claim to be 4k or even 8k.

This far surpasses them all in quality and pixle density.

Good job.

Edited November 14, 2014 by B15hop

Running at UHD, 3840x2160 on my 50" Samsung TV.

I've never tried playing KSP on a TV, mine is also Samsung. How did you get it hooked up?

HDMI Cable usually works, most graphics cards should have a direct plug built in. If using an older one that is not HDMI capable you can buy an adapter for a few bucks at any electronics store, make sure you did not get one with your card first as they were included for awhile, also check to see if your TV can use your monitor cord instead of the HDMI cord. I have my computer in the room behind my tv and put a hole in the wall with a really long usb cable and a powered hub at the end to use my wireless inputs from my couch or chair.... way too comfy, keep falling asleep playing games....lol.

Edit: Case in point half asleep lying down and didn't see the date on previous post... well may help someone so will leave this post here.

Hey green skull

Wanted to say how much I appreciate your work. I wanted a dark suit with dayglow green before I even knew you existed. Low and behold I found your work. I downloaded the MEGApack. I used ur suits but slightly modified them to loose the actual skulls. I just didn't want skulls on my suits. I had a problem with your default config though, all my fault because I don't know programming. I used the stock TR config file to resolve the issue of spawning on Kerbin with a helmet. It sucks because it automatically shows the reflection even if your not in Space. I used your Purple Haze skybox which is awesome btw. I then took those images and renamed and resized them to be the visor reflections. It looks great. Is there a way to set visor reflections to reflect one thing if on planets with clouds like kerbin and another if in space? I resolved the issue by making them spawn on kerbin without helmets but would love to make them have a different reflection if on certain planets.

EDIT: I would like to make visor show clouds if on kerbin or laythe and duststorms if on duna and purple clouds if on eve to match each planets actual enviroment. Tgen the skybox scene on all the other planets and moons.

Is anyone still in control of these packs? Is there any chance of releasing a separate Head texture pack? The head textures for Bob, Bill and Jeb (and Prof. Kerbinstein) in the KSP suits pack really are very good.
How i can do visor like mirror? not transparent. Like this
MediaFire links dont seem to be working. i have tried on several browsers. seems to be on a loop. anywhere else i can get them?

I think you just crank up the the values to 1 1 1

// Reflection colour. Reflection is multiplied by this RGB colour before it is

// added to the visor colour.

visorReflectionColour = 0.5 0.5 0.5

Note that to give it more of a gold finish, go with something more like 1 1 0.7

[quote name='Berlin']MediaFire links dont seem to be working. :( i have tried on several browsers. seems to be on a loop. anywhere else i can get them?[/QUOTE]

Just had to clear the cookies for mediafire.

On 28/02/2016 at 1:33 AM, Probe 1 said:

You might want to replace the downloads. Their kinda broken for me.

 

 

The download links are broken but the files are still hosted!

Here's how to get them:

1. Click the link on the pack and get it's URL

e.g. "http://www./download/01cc33c111h8bem/FASA-Pack-v0.38.zip"

2. Stick in "m e d i a f i r e . c o m" without the spaces between the "www." and the "/download"

As so. "http://www. m e d i a f i r e . c o m /download/01cc33c111h8bem/FASA-Pack-v0.38.zip"

Dont forget to remove the spaces.

3. Use this new link to get the download.

 

The forum says that  "m e d i a f i r e . c o m" is banned from use on this site. I think that's whats caused this.
